titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2201, MICRO OFFERING SAFE HARBOR ACT

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2201, MICRO OFFERING SAFE HARBOR ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 182

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Micro Offering Safe Harbor Act_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 609, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2201) to amend the Securities Act of 1933 to exempt certain micro-offerings from the registration requirements of such Act, by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 617 , after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 224 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 616.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Micro Offering Safe Harbor Act_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 609, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2201) to amend the Securities Act of 1933 to exempt certain micro-offerings from the registration requirements of such Act, by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 617 , after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 224 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 616.

titleInfo.title: VETERANS CRISIS LINE STUDY ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: VETERANS CRISIS LINE STUDY ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 182

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Veterans Crisis Line Study Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures. Consideration began Tuesday, November 7th. D1193<P/>H.R. 4173, amended, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to conduct a study on the Veterans Crisis Line, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 420 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 618; and

extension.searchTitle: HYDROPOWER POLICY MODERNIZATION ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 182

congCommittee.name: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
Oversight and Government Reform
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
Energy and Natural Resources

extension.searchTitle: RECESS; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 182
AFTER RECESS; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 182
HOUR OF MEETING ON TOMORROW; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 182
HYDROPOWER POLICY MODERNIZATION ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 182

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 3043, to modernize hydropower policy, by a recorded vote of 257 ayes to 166 noes, Roll No. 620.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, it shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Energy and Commerce now printed in the bill.<P/>Rush amendment in the nature of a substitute (No. 4 printed in H. Rept. 115-391) that sought to add a new section to the Federal Power Act (FPA) to improve the hydropower licensing process; direct the Commission and the Federal resource agencies to convene a negotiated rulemaking within 90 days of enactment with state and local government representatives, Indian tribes, and stakeholders to develop a process that will coordinate all necessary Federal authorizations and enable the Commission to make a final decision on a license not later than 3 years of receiving a completed license application (by a recorded vote of 185 ayes to 234 noes, Roll No. 619).

The House passed H.R. 3043, to modernize hydropower policy, by a recorded vote of 257 ayes to 166 noes, Roll No. 620.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, it shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Energy and Commerce now printed in the bill.<P/>Rush amendment in the nature of a substitute (No. 4 printed in H. Rept. 115-391) that sought to add a new section to the Federal Power Act (FPA) to improve the hydropower licensing process; direct the Commission and the Federal resource agencies to convene a negotiated rulemaking within 90 days of enactment with state and local government representatives, Indian tribes, and stakeholders to develop a process that will coordinate all necessary Federal authorizations and enable the Commission to make a final decision on a license not later than 3 years of receiving a completed license application (by a recorded vote of 185 ayes to 234 noes, Roll No. 619).
The House passed H.R. 3043, to modernize hydropower policy, by a recorded vote of 257 ayes to 166 noes, Roll No. 620.

titleInfo.title: VETERANS FAIR DEBT NOTICE ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: VETERANS FAIR DEBT NOTICE ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 182

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Veterans Fair Debt Notice Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures. Consideration began Tuesday, November 7th. D1193<P/>H.R. 3705, amended, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to require the use of certified mail and plain language in certain debt collection activities, by a 2/3 yea-and-nay vote of 422 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 621.

congVote.result: The PRESIDING OFFICER. Under the previous order, the motion to reconsider is considered made and laid upon the table and the President will be immediately notified of the Senate's action.

extension.searchTitle: CLOTURE MOTION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 182

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate resumed consideration of the nomination of William L. Wehrum, of Delaware, to be an Assistant Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 49 yeas to 46 nays (Vote No. 267), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.
